issue.description: 0) You do not really define the entity. It is the existence of a person in a position. (in fact it is a relationship and could have effectivity/times/dates/approvals applied to it) 1) Despite the fame of Bill Gates, ISO would not accept the use of real people (unless dead?) in examples. 2) Move the example into an example tag. 3) The note says "NOTE There can be max. 1 effective person_in_position for one position. " Please do no use such short hand as max. However the model only allows for more than one person to occupy a position over time or at the same time. You would have to add a rule to prevent more than one person at the same time. However, until date_time_assignments have been imported (in a higher level module) you cannot write this rule here using EXPRESS. You could add an Informal proposition. However I would instead suggest deleting the Note. There are such things as job-shares that could have 2 people in the same position at the same time.

comment.description: See also, comment on issue nks-11. Assume application of effectivity/times/dates/approvals is done at higher level. Examples reworded, note removed.
